commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I4dd441f65a364eeccff217c99bf423540c44e3f5

subject: Add COMPUTE_TIME_HPET trait
messages:
[{'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-10-05 13:18:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-10-05 13:21:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

The garbled comment could be fixed later, but we really should have the bp marked in the commit message.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-10-05 13:21:49.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from hpet to bp/support-hpet-on-guest'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-10-05 14:48:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-10-05 14:49:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Ja, gut.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-10-05 14:56:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2018-10-06 00:06:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I'm happy to use whatever trait is recommended, but it seems a little odd to me to consider it a "compute" thing since for qemu at least the HPET is purely an emulated device.  I think it'd be more accurate to view it as an emlated hardware timer for X86 that lives on the virtual motherboard somewhere.

Given the above, I was expecting something like HW_SYSTEM_X86_HPET, or maybe HW_TIME_X86_HPET.

But I'll go along with whatever is recommended.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-10-08 13:28:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> I'm happy to use whatever trait is recommended, but it seems a
 > little odd to me to consider it a "compute" thing since for qemu at
 > least the HPET is purely an emulated device.  I think it'd be more
 > accurate to view it as an emlated hardware timer for X86 that lives
 > on the virtual motherboard somewhere.
 > 
 > Given the above, I was expecting something like HW_SYSTEM_X86_HPET,
 > or maybe HW_TIME_X86_HPET.

I was thinking more along the lines of vTPM (vs a passthrough hardware-based TPM) when I placed HPET under COMPUTE_TIME_ namespace.

I agree that HW_TIME_X86_HPET is probably the best of the names suggested so far.

Thoughts from everyone else?

-jay'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-10-08 13:28:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-10-08 15:06:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

HW_TIME_X86_HPET would to me would imply the host
has a phyical hpet and i would expect the virt dirvier to only
advertise that trait if the HPET was actully enabled in the bios.

that is why i had assumed the compute namespace would be better to discribe the capablity fo the hyperviors (qemu in this case) to emulate a hpet as you could have just as eailay emulate a hpet for a x86 guest on a aarch64 server as you could on an x86 host but it would be incorrect IMHO to use HW_TIME_X86_HPET in this case as the host does not actully have a hpet'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-10-08 15:23:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yeah, to highlight one thing Sean mentions, my instinctive reaction to HW_TIME_X86_HPET was that the X86 bit shouldn't be there. *Today* it's only an X86 thing, but it would be awkward to try to figure out what to do if HPET becomes a thing elsewhere.

And the HW bit implies hardware to the exclusion of emulated IMO.

Not sure what value we gain by trying to be so precise. What would be wrong with just TIME_HPET?

That said, I'm leaving my +2 because I'm fine with the COMPUTE in COMPUTE_TIME_HPET, since it's the compute driver that's deciding whether it's capable, based on some combination of hardware, architecture, and emulation capability."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-11-19 14:33:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Per the spec, we don't need this trait anymore - we're just using a simple image property:

https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/stein/approved/support-hpet-on-guest.html#proposed-change

So it seems we can just abandon this now."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-11-19 14:38:00.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-05 13:18:57.000000000', 'message': 'Add COMPUTE_TIME_HPET trait

We need a trait that indicates a virt driver is capable of configuring a
high-precision event timer for a guest.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/High_Precision_Event_Timer

Note that we do NOT add a corresponding HW_TIME_HPET trait at this time.
It is supposed that for hardware HPET handling, it is likely that the
hardware HPET will be used as an inventoried resource class and not as a
trait, since only a single guest may have the HPET passed through as a
device to it.

Change-Id: I615992a34e5508e665a71da38b0704e9b60410be
'}, {'created': '2018-10-05 14:48:38.000000000', 'message': 'Add COMPUTE_TIME_HPET trait

We need a trait that indicates a virt driver is capable of configuring a
high-precision event timer for a guest.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/High_Precision_Event_Timer

Note that we do NOT add a corresponding HW_TIME_HPET trait at this time.

If in the future, it is necessary to differentiate somehow between
hardware and emulated HPET, it is expected that a hw:hpet_policy (or
similar) flavor/image extra spec will be created to instruct the virt
driver about this differentiation.

blueprint: support-hpet-on-guest

Change-Id: I615992a34e5508e665a71da38b0704e9b60410be
'}]
commit_message:
Add COMPUTE_TIME_HPET trait

We need a trait that indicates a virt driver is capable of configuring a
high-precision event timer for a guest.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/High_Precision_Event_Timer

Note that we do NOT add a corresponding HW_TIME_HPET trait at this time.

If in the future, it is necessary to differentiate somehow between
hardware and emulated HPET, it is expected that a hw:hpet_policy (or
similar) flavor/image extra spec will be created to instruct the virt
driver about this differentiation.

blueprint: support-hpet-on-guest

Change-Id: I615992a34e5508e665a71da38b0704e9b60410be

Gmann: seems you are using an old man page and some jobs are using a very old bash version

the "-A" declaration is for an associative array instead of an indexed one, see [1]. so simply changing it would usually break something, except that in this case it looks to me like it isn't being needed (anymore?) at all.

[1] https://www.gnu.org/software/bash/manual/html_node/Arrays.html'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-11-05 11:17:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

 > being needed (anymore?) at all.

commit_message:
docs: Fix plugin registry generation failures

This patch set fixes plugin registry generation script which
is resulting in the documentation page ending up empty [0].

This is because the script `tools/generate-tempest-plugins-list.sh`
is using an old flag (`-A`).

This drops the `declare -A plugins` command because `plugins` isn't
used anywhere and also uses `decode('utf-8')` on the initial response
lookup for all the projects which is done already in the script
elsewhere [2].

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/plugin-registry.html
[1] https://bash.cyberciti.biz/bash-reference-manual/Bash-Builtins.html#index-declare-132
[2] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/da8aec9aedcac940ba1dbc3beee50f05f13af3f1/tools/generate-tempest-plugins-list.py#L67

Change-Id: I70b59c869df06f35c0f7ca6d20e3584502cda8ef

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
messages: [{'account_id': 26297, 'date': '2018-10-03 01:59:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21922, 'date': '2018-11-19 13:52:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-03 01:59:05.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Iafb959ea0c81fd0a89faee48949dc0f0af3457b5
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Iafb959ea0c81fd0a89faee48949dc0f0af3457b5

commit_message:
Update infra URLs for Zanata scripts

The scripts for interfacting with Zanata are no longer contained in
project-config, update the URLs as well as referencing the
openstack-zuul-jobs repo where the scripts now live.

This also drives-by all git.openstack.org URLs to be https.

Change-Id: Ifd80e80ec8e7006bd0964daf84cdc38eef776f75

commit_message:
Bump version to 1.4.0

`new-release` command from release repo forces skipping 1.3.0 and
bumping to 1.4.0 directly as we haven't released a delivery in Rocky
cycle.

commit_message:
sahara-image-pack: remove bashisms from shell scripts

During image generation, some shell scripts are run inside the image
(e.g. wget_repo). Those scripts are run with /bin/sh but some parts are
written with Bash-specific syntax. This commit replaces those parts by
sh-compliant syntaxes.

Change-Id: If64b85c7b026a70c99190a2cb6487e3f1b865928
Story: #2003893
Task: #26767
Task: #26776
(cherry picked from commit 3a2b3f63b77267847ed16061cfcb17fd97ba4c21)

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2017-03-01 13:38:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Honestly, what about just fixing things up so we don't create the snapshot when rotation=0?

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/compute/manager.py#L3063
and
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/compute/api.py#L2683

are the two lines we could just skip to stop that extra snapshot happening when rotation==0"}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2017-03-01 13:40:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Just as a follow up, you can only skip creating the snapshot in the API if the min_service version is high enough that no completes are expecting the API to no longer take the snapshot, but we can walk you through that later on, if needed.'}, {'account_id': 20182, 'date': '2017-03-03 07:19:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi John,

Thank you for suggestions.

IMO if rotation is 0 then we can eliminate the rpc call [1] which will delete the snapshot by deleting the snapshot from api only, for this purpose we can move the snapshot deletion code [2] to common place(compute utils) and call it from api as well as manager side. Only consequence of this is that response will be delayed as we are deleting the snapshot from the api side. IMHO the reason behind eliminating the rpc call is any malicious user can send multiple requests with rotation 0 which will increase the traffic on rpc side. Please let me know your opinion about the same.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/compute/api.py#L2693
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/compute/manager.py#L3178'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2017-03-06 11:05:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I think we should keep the processing where it is.

To ensure the API scales well, we try to dispatch work to an external system as quickly as possible. I would prefer if we keep the same flow was when rotation >0, so we don't change the scaling characteristics of the system."}, {'account_id': 11303, 'date': '2017-03-06 13:48:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck-zkvm'}, {'account_id': 20040, 'date': '2017-03-06 15:03:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi Andrey Volkov, Thanks for your review,

Actually I was proposed the same solution that you have suggested, in patch set 3 of this patch For reference: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/409644/3 but in that case user will need to delete the last backup of an instance explicitly from glance and that is not the good thing to do, so to skip this explicit deletion of backup image I have made changes in logic and allowed to pass the rotation parameter value as 0 and just skip overhead of creation of image.'}, {'account_id': 21813, 'date': '2017-09-28 09:33:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

If you backup an instance by passing rotation as 0 to the backup
api, then nova creates an image in glance and takes a snapshot
of an instance and then deletes it immediately. Creation of an
image and snapshot is an unnecessary step.

This patch changes the 'rotation' parameter min value from 0 to 1.
Caveat: The last backup of an instance should be deleted by user
explicitly.

if user passes rotation parameter value as 0.

DocImpact: Minimum value for rotation parameter should be 1.

Closes-Bug: #1627597

commit_message:
Don't create instance backup image if rotation is 0

If a user passes rotation parameter as 0 to the instance backup API,
nova creates an image and take a snapshot of the instance and then
deletes it immediately.

This patch won't create an image and take a snapshot of an instance
if rotation parameter is 0 but it will delete all the backups
as it is doing currently.

Change-Id: Ie95f5c39c478ae69b697414347ae5272a205fb07
Closes-Bug: #1627597

Due to the containerization, looking into ansible_facts to
obtain results about mounts is not working. We will use simple
df to loop on needed volumes instead.

This change also fixes the old outdate documentation links in
both undercloud-disk-space and undercloud-disk-space-pre-upgrade
validations.

Change-Id: I5c7b2558b55e45d6f7c15d41e558825cabe0b130
(cherry picked from commit 8834a4a1ab2d1c5c460a5d1b8282f565282db2b6)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix disk space validation

Due to the containerization, looking into ansible_facts to
obtain results about mounts is not working. We will use simple
df to loop on needed volumes instead.

This change also fixes the old outdate documentation links in
both undercloud-disk-space and undercloud-disk-space-pre-upgrade
validations.

Change-Id: I5c7b2558b55e45d6f7c15d41e558825cabe0b130
(cherry picked from commit 8834a4a1ab2d1c5c460a5d1b8282f565282db2b6)

commit_message:
Convert SelectRolesDialog to ModalPanel

Since the number of Available Roles is growing, ordinary Modal is
not sufficient for showing the data.

* Convert SelectRolesDialog Modal to ModalPanel
* Make role cards the same height and show role detail modal
  on role title click
* Role detail includes name, description, tags, networks and
  services

Story: 2004253
Task: 27789

Change-Id: I68733bfb66f72caa5f48c1918962f0f3bdd15da7

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 19138, 'date': '2018-11-05 14:59:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 19138, 'date': '2018-11-14 14:04:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2018-11-14 14:51:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

recheck -- the undercloud upgrade job should be passing now i think'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2018-11-14 15:00:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-2

Questions arose whether TripleO should even be configuring an NFS area for glance's cache. -2 for now until that question is settled."}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2018-11-14 16:01:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Think we need to address Alan's concerns"}, {'account_id': 19138, 'date': '2018-11-15 11:10:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 19138, 'date': '2018-11-15 11:16:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

There are few major reasons of not having an nfs share for the cache are listed below,

1.  To store cache info sqlite db is used. By default, sqlite file gets stored in the same cache directory(so would also be on the cache nfs), 
    In case of sqlite when the DB is created, we specify MEMORY for the location of the sqlite temp_store, so there is possibility that data could get out of sync on each node between writes out to the disk.

2.  If we configure glance cache with nfs share, we'd have to make sure that only one of the nodes runs the pruner and cleaner.

3.  Glance uses lock on sqlite db so that the DB is created by only one worker, in case of multiple nodes accessing the db on NFS, we might face the concurrency issue.

4.  Fundamental problem is the whole point of using a cache is to save network bandwidth by not having to transfer images each time over the network so having the cache on nfs is self defeating.


To keep all the comments/reasons track of not providing an nfs for the cache on one patch, I'm avoiding abandoning this patch."}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2018-11-15 14:22:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

Thanks, Pranali, for latest patch set. Removing the NFS changes completely addresses my concerns. The patch that remains is nice and concise, and allows enabling the cache in situations such as an Edge deployment. Thank you for your persistence in working through the comments.'}, {'account_id': 19138, 'date': '2018-11-16 04:50:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2018-11-16 15:20:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

why are 001 and 003 red?'}, {'account_id': 19138, 'date': '2018-11-16 16:23:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

John, sorry I didn't get you comment :( could you please elaborate ?"}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2018-11-19 09:02:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

scenario failures seem unrelated to me'}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2018-11-19 09:17:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2018-11-19 09:18:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2018-11-19 09:58:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2018-11-19 10:00:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Workflow+1

I can't see any job for this patch still running at https://review.rdoproject.org/zuul/status so i guess there won't be any additional CI results. Merging."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-25 05:09:08.000000000', 'message': "Enable Glance Image Cache in OOO

Enabling glance image cache by setting up value of 'flavor' to
'keystone+cachemanagement' in glance-api.conf from THT.

For split-controlplane, glance cache will be enabled on remote
nodes and glance cache directory needs to be shared across all
the nodes. Hence enabling glance cache NFS share across all the
nodes to share the cache location.

Change-Id: I9a87d8edcb2e98ae45e98439b44b659916e44d89
blueprint: split-controlplane-glance-cache
"}, {'created': '2018-10-25 08:01:39.000000000', 'message': "Enable Glance Image Cache in OOO

Enabling glance image cache by setting up value of 'flavor' to
'keystone+cachemanagement' in glance-api.conf from THT.

For split-controlplane, glance cache will be enabled on remote
nodes and glance cache directory needs to be shared across all
the nodes. Hence enabling glance cache NFS share across all the
nodes to share the cache location.

Change-Id: I9a87d8edcb2e98ae45e98439b44b659916e44d89
blueprint: split-controlplane-glance-cache
"}, {'created': '2018-10-25 12:30:10.000000000', 'message': "Enable Glance Image Cache in OOO

Enabling glance image cache by setting up value of 'flavor' to
'keystone+cachemanagement' in glance-api.conf from THT.

For split-controlplane, glance cache will be enabled on remote
nodes and glance cache directory needs to be shared across all
the nodes. Hence enabling glance cache NFS share across all the
nodes to share the cache location.

Change-Id: I9a87d8edcb2e98ae45e98439b44b659916e44d89
blueprint: split-controlplane-glance-cache

Enabling glance image cache by setting up value of 'flavor' to
'keystone+cachemanagement' in glance-api.conf from THT.

To avoid duplication of caching, it would be better to enable glance
NFS share across all the nodes to make the cache directory shared.
Hence adding NFS share as well which is optional while enabling glance
image cache.

commit_message:
Enable Glance Image Cache

Enabling glance image cache by setting up value of 'flavor' to
'keystone+cachemanagement' in glance-api.conf from THT.

Change-Id: I9a87d8edcb2e98ae45e98439b44b659916e44d89
blueprint: split-controlplane-glance-cache

commit_message:
Update min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.  Update to
reflect reality, which should help with local running of constraints
targets.

Change-Id: I207e7da86a8a1c12dff8b5a24899758008424d1e

commit_message:
Set ramdisk logs path for ironic inspector

If the [processing] ramdisk_logs_dir option is set, logs returned by the
ironic inspection ramdisk following hardware inspection will be stored
at that location. This enables easier debugging if inspection fails.

Change-Id: I36bdf75c04b088b67b5f54fdf20251c10bdddb63

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-10 20:35:59.000000000', 'message': "Handle unicode characters in migration params

There can be unicode characters in the params for live migration, for
example, the guest domain name in the destination XML. We need to
convert those to bytes when we call migrateToURI3 under python2.

The existing code was just calling str() for this, but that will fail
with the error:

  UnicodeEncodeError: 'ascii' codec can't encode characters...

We need to encode the unicode characters to do conversion.

The existing unit test wasn't using any unicode characters in its test
data, so this scenario wasn't covered.

Closes-Bug: #1768807

Change-Id: I4b34139a3c5e3e2b7cf7cbe50bdf3da3131b9b1c
"}]
commit_message:
Handle unicode characters in migration params

There can be unicode characters in the params for live migration, for
example, the guest domain name in the destination XML. We need to
convert those to bytes when we call migrateToURI3 under python2.

The existing code was just calling str() for this, but that will fail
with the error:

  UnicodeEncodeError: 'ascii' codec can't encode characters...

We need to encode the unicode characters to do conversion.

The existing unit test wasn't using any unicode characters in its test
data, so this scenario wasn't covered.

Closes-Bug: #1768807

Change-Id: I4b34139a3c5e3e2b7cf7cbe50bdf3da3131b9b1c

commit_message:
Refactor devstack-plugin

* Make monasca-event-api devstack plugin compatible
with monaca devstack metrics and logs plugins
* Add monasca-ui
* Enable events visualization in kibana
* By default metrics and logs pipelines are disabled
* Change deployment mode from gunicorn to uwsgi

Story: 2003815
Task: 26569

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/593602/
Change-Id: I7efb969d89f0733bf27517d393cd024750e278a7

commit_message:
Fix : notifier problem with retype and backup

There appears to be a race condition while sending notifications
to ceilometer with rpc.
the backup.createprogress notification is called within a
loopingcall method which appears to be the main cause of the
failures.
This patch addresses the issue.

Change-Id: I2f71b7a6c33b7016b97953aee746d944c6809504
Closes-Bug: #1803648

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-18 07:19:06.000000000', 'message': "Add timeout parameter to 'connect_get_namespaced_pod_exec'

Sometimes the 'connect_get_namespaced_pod_exec' call is hanging
see [1] from some reason (on OS select) although the command
completed.
To resolve that we add support for '_request_timeout' parameter,
default value set to 20 seconds.

[1]: https://github.com/kubernetes-client/python/issues/559

Change-Id: Iea480269f7623e687fee41fb859537c026227c05
"}]
commit_message:
Add timeout parameter to 'connect_get_namespaced_pod_exec'

Sometimes the 'connect_get_namespaced_pod_exec' call is hanging
see [1] from some reason (on OS select) although the command
completed.
To resolve that we add support for '_request_timeout' parameter,
default value set to 20 seconds.

[1]: https://github.com/kubernetes-client/python/issues/559

Change-Id: Iea480269f7623e687fee41fb859537c026227c05

commit_message:
Move ovsdbapp jobs to its tree

This patch is moving the legacy CI jobs for ovsdbapp into its tree. This
will give the project more flexibility to control what jobs should run
in which pipeline as well as facilitate creation/deletion/updates for
new and existing jobs.

Change-Id: I2e34bd16ab9907bdc3f9225b879f9b0846d2c779
(cherry picked from commit 969a201ee45d60d1682679496dd0a967a251c14e)

Remove old directory so that link can be created properly

This patch fixes symbolik link to be located in exact path for
/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/openstack_dashboard .

Change-Id: I7c7679e8f5d0a5906860249bb029f90b71a411d2

commit_message:
IPv6 support for ODL-OVS deployment

Add feature to also set OVS manager to the IPv6
address of ODL based on "enable_ipv6" flag value.

Change-Id: I88d369082de1ce71cdeddf69287867c0af6d9e07
Closes-Bug: #1783067

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-11-08 16:09:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: -Code-Review

(10:07:53 AM) dansmith: mriedem: so on that.. is there any reason we need to or should limit that based on config?
(10:08:24 AM) dansmith: mriedem: because it doesn't really make sense to look at cells we think aren't going to have anything
(10:08:43 AM) mriedem: maybe not"}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-11-08 18:35:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-25034 : SUCCESS in 2h 40m 43s'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-11-08 20:26:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> (10:07:53 AM) dansmith: mriedem: so on that.. is there any reason
 > we need to or should limit that based on config?
 > (10:08:24 AM) dansmith: mriedem: because it doesn't really make
 > sense to look at cells we think aren't going to have anything
 > (10:08:43 AM) mriedem: maybe not

Yeah, so my thinking on this is the following:

On instance list, we have the config so that if you don't confine tenants to specific cells, looking up the list of distinct cells every time we do a list is more expensive than just hitting them all in parallel and getting back zero for some. Users do instance list *a lot* and spreading across cells is the more common case.

On boot where we're checking quota, the same situation exists, in that there's a break point above which it's cheaper to query fewer cells and below which it's better to just try them all. Boot is a heavy operation, and done far less often than a list. So, maybe it makes sense to always do the smaller check for quota, especially since we ignore cells that may be down naturally if we happen to not have any instances there.

Anyway, I'm fine either way I was just thinking about it maybe not making as much sense for quota checks. I'm cool with whichever way this goes though."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-11-08 20:45:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

If the down-cell quota check is affected based on the config, then I think that would be the deciding factor for me. And it looks like it would:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/614783/3/nova/quota.py

So let's say the cloud doesn't confine tenants to specific cells, and there are 10 cells and my project has instances in cells 1, 2 and 3. Cell 5, which I don't have instances in, goes down. Does that mean if I don't pass the policy check I will be unable to create instances, even though I don't have anything currently in the down cell? Because that would be bad. With a cloud that restricts tenants to cells, cell 5 being down wouldn't be an issue because the results of the scatter/gather for instances for my project wouldn't include cell 5.

So given that, it seems we'd want to *always* restrict the quota check to cells in which the project currently has instances and not consider the config option when counting quota."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-11-08 20:55:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Based on what I mentioned below, I think we should just avoid the config option and always filter cells by which ones the project has instances in. We could optimize to not do the instance mapping lookup by looking at the CELLS cache and if there is only one non-cell0 cell we just leave the code as-is. Not sure if that optimization needs to be part of this change or a follow up. But my -1 is for removing the config condition from this because I think it's important for the down-cell case to not restrict people from creating new servers if they don't have any in down cells."}, {'account_id': 26936, 'date': '2018-11-09 09:41:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(4 comments)

> If the down-cell quota check is affected based on the config, then
 > I think that would be the deciding factor for me. And it looks like
 > it would:
 > 
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/614783/3/nova/quota.py
 > 
 > So let's say the cloud doesn't confine tenants to specific cells,
 > and there are 10 cells and my project has instances in cells 1, 2
 > and 3. Cell 5, which I don't have instances in, goes down. Does
 > that mean if I don't pass the policy check I will be unable to
 > create instances, even though I don't have anything currently in
 > the down cell? Because that would be bad. With a cloud that
 > restricts tenants to cells, cell 5 being down wouldn't be an issue
 > because the results of the scatter/gather for instances for my
 > project wouldn't include cell 5.
 > 
 > So given that, it seems we'd want to *always* restrict the quota
 > check to cells in which the project currently has instances and not
 > consider the config option when counting quota.

oh you are right! okay then let's always restrict tenants based query for quota and I will use the Cache to optimize,

Rest of the comments are for the old patch set which you have already addressed, please ignore them."}, {'account_id': 26936, 'date': '2018-11-09 09:48:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Based on what I mentioned below, I think we should just avoid the
 > config option and always filter cells by which ones the project has
 > instances in.

ack

 > We could optimize to not do the instance mapping
 > lookup by looking at the CELLS cache 

sure we could, but when do we decide to pull freshly versus run the query based on project_id ? 

 > and if there is only one
 > non-cell0 cell we just leave the code as-is. Not sure if that
 > optimization needs to be part of this change or a follow up. But my
 > -1 is for removing the config condition from this because I think
 > it's important for the down-cell case to not restrict people from
 > creating new servers if they don't have any in down cells.

I will remove the config first and if we have better optimization ideas for deployments of <= 10 cells size who might hate this query, we can do it.."}, {'account_id': 26936, 'date': '2018-11-09 10:03:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> sure we could, but when do we decide to pull freshly versus run the
 > query based on project_id ?
 > 

yikes, I meant pull out of the cache versus query freshly based on project_id'}, {'account_id': 26936, 'date': '2018-11-09 10:31:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 26936, 'date': '2018-11-09 10:32:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 26936, 'date': '2018-11-09 10:37:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Make _instances_cores_ram_count() be smart about cells

This makes the _instances_cores_ram_count() method only query for instances
in cells that the tenant actually has instances landed in. We do this by
getting a list of cell mappings that have instance mappings owned by the
project and limiting the scatter/gather operation to just those cells.

Change-Id: I0e2a9b2460145d3aee92f7fddc4f4da16af63ff8
Closes-Bug: #1771810

subject: Using pip as a python module
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 11564, 'name': 'Chris Dent', 'email': 'cdent@anticdent.org', 'username': 'chdent'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 28522, 'name': 'Hervé Beraud', 'email': 'herveberaud.pro@gmail.com', 'username': 'hberaud'}, {'_account_id': 29222, 'name': 'Natal Ngétal', 'email': 'hobbestigrou@erakis.eu', 'username': 'hobbestigrou'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2018-10-15 09:31:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 29222, 'date': '2018-10-15 09:35:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-10-15 12:26:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I wonder whether instead we should get less specific about methods for installing tools like pip, bindep and tox? For one thing, `sudo pip install ...` is discouraged by the Python packaging community and Linux distros alike since it results in different package managers fighting over control of files/directories.

There are packages for most of these in typical distros, but they can also be managed in virtualenvs or through other means.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-10-15 12:41:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

It is a standard module, but I don't see why we would want to switch to using it this way. Is there a reason you want to make this change?"}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2018-10-15 15:29:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> It is a standard module, but I don't see why we would want to
 > switch to using it this way. Is there a reason you want to make
 > this change?

No specific reasons... I've seen that on some others brick of openstack documentation so I decide to uniformize it"}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-16 11:35:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

The main benefit of using pip as a module is that it can remove a lot of ambiguity about which version of python you are using when you call it. You may think your main python is python3 but the 'pip' console script on the $PATH may be pointing off into python2.

I agree that we need a bit more thought about this, in terms of how we want to advise people to be using and installing pip, along the lines of fungi's comments.

Also, there's a relevant typo in the commit message."}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2018-10-22 13:46:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 29222, 'date': '2018-10-22 16:42:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-10-29 11:31:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-10-29 12:24:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Re-registering my objection from earlier. Better that we just remove instructions showing how to install tools and link to their installation instructions or something instead. I don't think this document ought to be in the business of explaining how to go about installing things."}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2018-11-19 09:32:15.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Add ironic-status upgrade check command framework

This adds basic framework for ironic-status upgrade
check commands. For now it has only "check_placeholder"
check implemented.
Real checks can be added to this tool in the future.

Change-Id: I7d5f018656322b92c663a2adaaf6330a55c00fb8
Story: 2003657
Task: 26133

commit_message:
Enhanced checksum support

This patch adds the ability to pass new hash fields os_hash_algo
and os_hash_value to IPA.

Glance will not re-compute hash values for existing images (they only
update these fields for newly uploaded images), so the os_hash_algo
and os_hash_value can be None.

In the case of direct interface with http provisioning, there
are two hash computing, one is for md5 checksum, and the other is
for new os_hash_algo (if it exists). If the os_hash_algo is
configured to md5, we'll bypass and wouldn't pass os_hash_algo to
IPA, because it's a waste of resource.

Change-Id: Iff72194787561b936efe3572e2b7a70217165a82
Story: 2003938
Task: 26845

commit_message:
Set default notifier endpoint

The notifier endpoint needs to be set otherwise the default default_email
notifier driver will complain about the empty smtp server url [1].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/freezer-dr/blob/master/freezer_dr/notifiers/drivers/default/default_email.py#L37-L38

Change-Id: I9ac4669ecc50ce93adf28084ab6280b66c4dc2f0

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-14 03:17:22.000000000', 'message': 'Rollback detaching when reserving volume is failed

Reserving volume will raise InvalidVolume exception when
the volume status is not right:
1. volume is multiattach, status must be available or in-use.
2. volume is not multiattach, status must be available.
In this case, we should rollback detaching the old volume as well.

Change-Id: I4fa84eed7b0e71989c46eaae7da5388c52d243b7
'}]
commit_message:
Rollback detaching when reserving volume is failed

Reserving volume will raise InvalidVolume exception when
the volume status is not right:
1. volume is multiattach, status must be available or in-use.
2. volume is not multiattach, status must be available.
In this case, we should rollback detaching the old volume as well.

Change-Id: I4fa84eed7b0e71989c46eaae7da5388c52d243b7

commit_message:
Add framework for masakari-status upgrade check

This commit adds the functionality of masakari-status CLI for performing
upgrade checks as part of the Stein cycle upgrade-checkers goal.
It only includes a sample check which must be replaced by real checks in
future.

Change-Id: I17c79af15eca5f6da7e32dbedbdc392c97114d42
Story: 2003657
Task: 26140

commit_message:
use neutron-lib for _model_query

The model_query module is in neutron-lib and the CommonDBMixin will
eventually be removed. This patch swiches use of the _model_query
method over to query_with_hooks from neutron-lib.

This patch also bumps the neutron-lib version up to 1.20.0

Change-Id: Ic32d92f6f956cd119722161fa2b157312d390dc0

been deprecated with the new recommendation to build the sdist and

Luckily, there is already a job that covers this that only runs when the

pep8 job redundant. This covered by the test-release-openstack-python3
that is defined in the publish-to-pypi-python3 template.

More details can be found in this mailing list post:

Change-Id: If386c764a69aa2ee04cfc1c7fe9989d8fd483c91
'}]
commit_message:
Remove setup.py check from pep8 job

Using "python setup.py check -r -s" method of checking the package has
been deprecated with the new recommendation to build the sdist and
wheel, then running "twine check" against the output.

Luckily, there is already a job that covers this that only runs when the
README, setup.py, or setup.cfg files change, making running this in the
pep8 job redundant. This covered by the test-release-openstack-python3
that is defined in the publish-to-pypi-python3 template.

More details can be found in this mailing list post:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/136136.html

Change-Id: If386c764a69aa2ee04cfc1c7fe9989d8fd483c91

I will include the ones I indicate din my next update.'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2018-06-27 05:31:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-06-27 16:12:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-06-27 17:45:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-06-27 22:26:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-06-27 22:30:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Published edit on patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-06-28 00:46:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(31 comments)

My main beef here is the separation of responsibilities between os-acc and the plugin.  TL;DR: The plugin should communicate with cyborg *only* by way of the VAN objects.  It should *not* be calling the cyborg API - that should be done in the os-acc code surrounding the call to the plugin method.

Eventually we'll need more clarity on plugin registration and can_handle, but I think it'll be better to hammer that out in implementation."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-06-28 00:48:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

FYI all, here's the rendered version of this spec:

http://logs.openstack.org/38/577438/6/check/build-openstack-sphinx-docs/d2219f5/html/specs/rocky/approved/compute-node.html"}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2018-06-28 06:12:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(23 comments)

Thanks for the comments, Eric. I agree the os-acc can/should update the Cyborg db rather than leave it to the plugin. However, it is too restrictive to say a plugin should not call Cyborg ever -- that is up to the implementation of the plugin. That is the whole purpose of having plugins.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-06-28 18:33:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(13 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-06-28 18:40:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)

acking what eric said about the api design

If there isn't already it might make sense to have a separate spec just about the api that is going to be presented."}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2018-06-29 02:23:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(14 comments)'}, {'account_id': 17813, 'date': '2018-06-29 17:21:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Hi sundar,
Move on our disscussion here. 
As shaohe said, policy check means RBAC authorization.
We can't just use horizon's check. Imagine that one can use a httpclient like curl xxx:xxx/accelerator to bypass the check.
In fact, when you can cyborg-agent directly, there is no api server in the process, so there is no policy check. 


For the multiple MQ brokers,sometimes we need to share flow in one environment. It seperates by project, not by node.

For the quota update, I agree with u, but if attach failed, maybe we have to call by nova-compute=>os-acc=>cyborg-api=>cyborg-agent(Recover config of device or clean up the bitstream). Do you want to maintain 2 different way to call cyborg?

Besids, please look at the comment inline."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-06-29 21:33:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 27458, 'date': '2018-06-30 02:18:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)'}, {'account_id': 17813, 'date': '2018-06-30 10:45:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: -Code-Review

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2018-07-06 02:23:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(10 comments)

Eric and Li Liu, please see my responses. Li Liu, I am not sure why you gave a -1: you had a bunch of questions but is there a showstopper here?'}, {'account_id': 17813, 'date': '2018-07-06 15:20:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2018-07-19 08:23:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 14131, 'date': '2018-07-19 13:03:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-07-27 21:36:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(15 comments)

Apologies for the delay getting back to this.

I think an understanding of what a "cyborg driver" is, and how its responsibilities differ from that of a "plugin", would help me reconcile my concerns here. But I think we're getting close to understanding each other.'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2018-08-14 15:24:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-08-14 16:04:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-08-14 16:04:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

PS8 rebase to resolve merge conflict (spec was moved).'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2018-08-14 16:09:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9: Patch Set 8 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2018-08-14 17:14:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(20 comments)

Thanks for all the input. I think I have addressed most of them in change set 9 and a few minor ones are coming in change set 10. The main one still remaining is the Cyborg REST API extension to GET/PUT individual VANs.'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2018-08-15 19:38:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2018-08-22 21:04:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 11878, 'date': '2018-08-24 00:55:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

Please fix pep8'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-08-24 21:38:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

(81 comments)

let me star by saying this needs to be split into atleast 3 specs.
we need one spec for os-acc.
we need another for the interaction between os-acc and cyborg.
we need a final spec for os-acc and nova.

the glance interaction is a seperat worklfow between the cyborg-agent and glance and should not be in the spec.

i personally feel this is very far from been a viable proposal and need quite alot of work to get to a point where we can realistically address cyborg integration with nova in stein.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-08-27 20:07:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

Sundar, here's a diff that'll get this rendering your seqdiag properly (and fixes a couple of other rendering issues): http://paste.openstack.org/show/728871/

I'm still working my way through the content."}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2018-09-02 02:58:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(60 comments)

Thanks for the comments, Sean. For now, I have punted the notion of os-acc plugins until we get clear use cases.'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2018-09-02 03:00:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Thanks for the comments, Sean. For now, I have punted the notion of os-acc plugins until we get clear use cases.'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2018-09-02 03:01:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Thanks, Eric. I have included this update.'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2018-09-02 03:02:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2018-09-05 00:09:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2018-09-05 01:32:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2018-09-10 16:20:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

sundar can you revert the changes to the rocky spec when you next respin.'}, {'account_id': 27458, 'date': '2018-10-03 01:46:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Code-Review+1

As this is getting stable from reviews.'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2018-11-19 05:50:48.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

At the Stein PTG, a new flow was proposed and it was also agreed that the specs need to be refactored with some parts going into Nova specs repo, and some into Cyborg specs repo. Accordingly, this spec has been replaced by:

subject: Set ServiceNetMap for standalone explicitly
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'shardy@redhat.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 8833, 'name': 'Rabi Mishra', 'email': 'ramishra@redhat.com', 'username': 'rabi'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 18846, 'name': 'RedHat RDO CI', 'email': 'rdo-ci-admins@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdo-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-11-03 02:55:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-11-03 05:36:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-11-05 10:37:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-11-05 10:39:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> what's the issue this attempts for solve?
Needed by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/614457/ for the standalone jobs."}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-11-05 10:42:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I can add Related-Bug: #1800811 for clarity though.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-11-05 11:01:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-11-06 15:01:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

This is not correct because this could be any service. The standalone is supposed to support just about any service being enabled so this list is incomplete and I'm not sure it's the right way to handle this."}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-11-07 04:36:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> The standalone is supposed to support just about any service being enabled so this list is incomplete and I'm not sure it's the right way to handle this.

How is a service (other than what's enabled by default) expected to be enabled in standalone or How do we provide additional parameters? [1] can't be changed it seems as it's part of pep8 check[2].


[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/environments/standalone/standalone-tripleo.yaml
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/57/614457/6/check/openstack-tox-pep8/2c4ac9a/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-11-02_07_41_05_633717"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-11-08 05:08:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Additional environment files will be provided to enable the services. Example being like...

openstack tripleo deploy -e THT/environments/standalone/standalone-tripleo.yaml -e THT/services/ironic.yaml -e THT/services/ironic-inspector.yaml

This is why the ServiceNetMap needs to be dynamic. Can we provide a single parameter that could be used to set all the values automatically rather than having to be specified?'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-11-08 08:31:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Additional environment files will be provided to enable the services

That's exactly what I've been talking about. Use a new environment to enable more services and also provide a ServiceNetMap that overrides the default one (to include networks for the new services and possibly different networks than that we use in the gate for standalone). We don't have to create anything dynamically (It's for the user to override what he/she wants to change)."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-11-08 14:46:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

No the problem is you need a map that encompasses all the services you enable. The point of the standalone is to be super easy to enable/disable services. Having to have the user manually create a ServiceNetMap for all the services they selected is a nonstarter IMHO.'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-11-12 17:25:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I agree it's not great to have any hard-coded ServiceNetMap here, the idea is it's composable, with optional service->network mapping override by operators.

I made a suggestion in the other patch re perhaps using a j2 variable to avoid this duplication, but still enable easier per-role override of e.g internal_api to ctlplane (regardless of which services are enabled)."}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-11-19 04:46:13.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Add framework for panko-status upgrade check

This commit adds the functionality of panko-status CLI for performing
upgrade checks as part of the Stein cycle upgrade-checkers goal.
It only includes a sample check which must be replaced by real checks in
future.

Change-Id: Ice0df931b8bd111b0a99ab70633c1b2aabb3c051
Story: 2003657
Task: 27734

commit_message:
doc: Add minimal documentation for MKS consoles

I did know this was a thing but only barely. As with RDP, the
documentation is very minimal but it should contain enough pointers for
anyone playing with this stuff.

Change-Id: I0b62d42eae7c325566ee065dcdc0f73b7223d471

doc: Add minimal documentation for RDP consoles

I didn't even know this was a thing. Call it out...and promptly link to
the Cloudbase documentation, which I don't want to reproduce here for
reasons of expediency.

commit_message:
doc: Rewrite the console doc

The link between the various consoles was never well understood (by me,
at least). Clarify this by restructuring the document to highlight the
few differences between these services.

Change-Id: I08991796aaced2abc824f608108c0c786181eb65

commit_message:
Deprecate nova-network code

Nova will be removing nova-network soon, this deprecates all
the classes and parameters that are related to nova-network
and will be removed when nova removes it's support.

Please see references in nova.conf [1] and the nova release notes. [2]

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/rocky/configuration/sample-config.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/nova/rocky.html

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/614577/
Change-Id: If87ad30e1be62cb767d98045d075340c9513bc90

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-25 23:28:32.000000000', 'message': "Deprecate all paste code

Keystone no longer uses it's paste ini file or
uses the paste deploy parts so we deprecate all
that now. [1]

Unfortunately this should probably have been done
in Rocky but got missed, in Stein keystone will

commit_message:
Deprecate all paste code

Keystone no longer uses it's paste ini file or
uses the paste deploy parts so we deprecate all
that now. [1]

Unfortunately this should probably have been done
in Rocky but got missed, in Stein keystone will
effectively remove the paste ini file. [1]

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/keystone/rocky.html

Change-Id: Ifefea626f754d247b376745fbb2791e725ebafbc
Closes-Bug: 1794045

commit_message:
Fix: TestMasakariAPI tests skipped due to missing __init__.py

__init__.py was missing in `masakari.tests.unit.cmd` package, hence
all tests under that package were skipped.

This patch fixes all failing unit tests after adding __init__.py.

Change-Id: I1a0133ff969260397158b0f3ebd7ca87439fd827
Closes-Bug: #1799634

commit_message:
Set hierdata for swift server workers conditionally

If not set, it would use the default os_workers fact instead of 'auto'
and limit the number of worker processes.

Change-Id: I69f51bb38f1307cf4b750e5ffb394eb215df1d9e
(cherry picked from commit b450b3aa39699e9bd10698a54759ddb8452c986d)

commit_message:
devstack: Define packages for (open)SUSE

Add devstack/files/rpms-suse/octavia file with a list of
dependencies than need to be installed on (open)SUSE to create an
image based on Ubuntu by diskimage-builder.

Change-Id: Iae54c0342f9040ba13eae9ad36426baeb98dd392
Signed-off-by: Michal Rostecki <mrostecki@suse.de>

commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I83986c645b21b3994c199c68419847d1507511de
Closes-Bug:  #1801454

commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I5e855bcb2503b9e4696566175b09b2947b86de1b
Closes-Bug:  #1801452

This didn't work for me, see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/605021/ and the alternative approach https://review.openstack.org/#/c/596428/ (didn't have a chance to test the latter)"}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-10-17 16:45:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Even if this may allow resize to work it would mess in other places. 

As far as I know LIBVIRT is supposed to be usable without having root access to the machine.

I do see normal for a user to download an image, resize it and use it, without any need to run code as root on his machine (or libvirt one which can be another one, specified by LIBVIRT_DEFAULT_URI)'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2018-10-17 17:26:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Skip the services with no endpoints when parsing service catalog

When parsing the service catalog to find the source, audit middleware
should skip over the services which have no endpoints instead of
assuming they will have at least one endpoint.

Change-Id: I287873e99338d95baaf20d52ecb3a43763a401fc
Closes-Bug: #1800017
(cherry picked from commit 6779838a242b222672721407cc320672ab24067a)

subject: Add ansible_python_interpreter to the inventory script
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-13 20:06:01.000000000', 'message': 'Add ansible_python_interpreter to the inventory script

In order to be able to specify that we would like to use python2 or
python3 with the generated ansible inventory, the
tripleo-ansible-inventory script should take this as a parameter like it
does for the ansible ssh user.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/617793/
Change-Id: If70d046b3bdb2b0bd9fcc334e53f72e97b127cd7
Related-Blueprint: python3-support
'}]
commit_message:
Add ansible_python_interpreter to the inventory script

In order to be able to specify that we would like to use python2 or
python3 with the generated ansible inventory, the
tripleo-ansible-inventory script should take this as a parameter like it
does for the ansible ssh user.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/617793/
Change-Id: If70d046b3bdb2b0bd9fcc334e53f72e97b127cd7
Related-Blueprint: python3-support

commit_message:
Switch stable scenarios to voting

In master we have removed these from the gate as they are non-voting
because we plan on replacing them with standalone versions. However for
stable branches we will want to leave these as voting since they are
defined in the gate in the branch layout.

Change-Id: I7a859ac1db9206301df897553320fca70ea33980
Related-Bug: #1802144
(cherry picked from commit 3061e5d1bce513b3d58eae963722569b7f9bb50b)

commit_message:
Use TinyIPA deployment images

The coreos images do not appear to be functional.
I didn't spend too much time debugging why, but it
seemed like they hung on boot (but that may just be a
lack of console logging).

The TinyIPA images can deploy a server without issue.

TrivialFix
Change-Id: I58e4f951d4a3dd89e0784fd82d8a62dbba374f79

commit_message:
Use TinyIPA deployment images

The coreos images do not appear to be functional.
I didn't spend too much time debugging why, but it
seemed like they hung on boot (but that may just be a
lack of console logging).

The TinyIPA images can deploy a server without issue.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I97bc80e516e684fd24ad453d24c5d77316539fb0

commit_message:
Bugfix: Add datasource_name to an entity also on update

The vitrage_datasource_name property should
be added to every vertex, to allow its late
deletion by the consistency enforcer if
needed [1].
Until now this property was added only at
vertex creation. It should be added also at
vertex update.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/588219/

Change-Id: I49a0a008b18805cc247cbe1c7b9ccf156c4bae9f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-30 16:13:45.000000000', 'message': 'Remove setup.py check from pep8 job

Using "python setup.py check -r -s" method of checking the package has
been deprecated with the new recommendation to build the sdist and
wheel, then running "twine check" against the output.

Luckily, there is already a job that covers this that only runs when the
README, setup.py, or setup.cfg files change, making running this in the
pep8 job redundant. This is covered by the test-release-openstack-python3
that is defined in the publish-to-pypi-python3 template.

More details can be found in this mailing list post:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/136136.html

Change-Id: I60ab96b2f69748e9fad65a73f168b414c14a857a
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove setup.py check from pep8 job

Using "python setup.py check -r -s" method of checking the package has
been deprecated with the new recommendation to build the sdist and
wheel, then running "twine check" against the output.

Luckily, there is already a job that covers this that only runs when the
README, setup.py, or setup.cfg files change, making running this in the
pep8 job redundant. This is covered by the test-release-openstack-python3
that is defined in the publish-to-pypi-python3 template.

More details can be found in this mailing list post:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/136136.html

Change-Id: I60ab96b2f69748e9fad65a73f168b414c14a857a
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

The func should be used in the condition of 'policies to policy'
Add test UT in test_resource_helper

commit_message:
Increase RAM for the ironic node in UEFI job

This now appears to need more then the bios jobs. A recent
update to one of the components of the tiny IPA image appears
to have increased the requirements.

Change-Id: Ia38ab45d0b1d7f7c57a2be71cf290de02ab86e6f
Story: 2004355
Task: 27954

commit_message:
Libnetfilter_log python binding

This patch introduces a libnetfilter_log python binding, this one used
for capturing NFLOG packet.

Partial-Bug: #1752290
Change-Id: I20252850d62b4e45048a1f916bbfd512a2826926

commit_message:
Add sync_db parameter in glance-api

As sync db is moved as a part of glance-api install, defining
sync_db parameter in glance::api

In the latest versions, it has been done during moving sync_db
parameter to glance-api and removing from glance-registry.
But backporting that change was changing major functionality in newton.

So, to avoid that, just adding sync_db in glance-api.

Change-Id: I209498033ea81571d45d9fbd69ff03e0155a9deb
Closes-Bug: 1731245

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Iad0076fbf34f699b9eb2134bae623793693534cb
Closes-Bug:  #1801657

commit_message:
Remove deprecated Ram/Disk filters in NovaSchedulerDefaultFilters

As reported in the related bug below and merged for the undercloud
with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/598167 the Ram/Disk filters
are deprecated since [1] so we should stop using them.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/596502/
Related-Bug: 1787910
Change-Id: Ib3585b4c04c974c34d61b868d0454df03c1a2aed
(cherry picked from commit 0ec9a3db94a6a0e09387f7d86860d93708c524db)

commit_message:
Noop out xinetd::service

With puppet 5.5.6, the xinetd::service being included by rsync::server
is force including the init.pp from xinetd. Since we don't actually want
any xinetd configurations in the container bits, we also need to noop
out xinetd::service along with the xinetd class.

Change-Id: I3075a852290d873915a61aae5fbe96202efb400f
Related-Blueprint: puppet5-support

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-15 17:41:26.000000000', 'message': 'DVR: Centralized FloatingIPs are not cleared after migration.

With DVR routers, if a port is associated with a FloatingIP,
before it is used by a VM, the FloatingIP will be initially
started at the Network Node SNAT Namespace, since the port
is not bound to any host.

Then when the port is attached to a VM, the port gets its
host binding, and then the FloatingIP setup should be migrated
to the Compute host and the original FloatingIP in the Network
Node SNAT Namespace should be cleared.

But the original FloatingIP setup in SNAT Namespace was not
cleared by the agent.

This patch addresses the issue.

Change-Id: I55a16bcc0020087aa1abe76f5bc85cd64ccdaecd
Closes-Bug: #1796491
(cherry picked from commit cd0cc47a6ab0f7968a8c24e9d477909c45e4ae87)
'}]
commit_message:
DVR: Centralized FloatingIPs are not cleared after migration.

With DVR routers, if a port is associated with a FloatingIP,
before it is used by a VM, the FloatingIP will be initially
started at the Network Node SNAT Namespace, since the port
is not bound to any host.

Then when the port is attached to a VM, the port gets its
host binding, and then the FloatingIP setup should be migrated
to the Compute host and the original FloatingIP in the Network
Node SNAT Namespace should be cleared.

But the original FloatingIP setup in SNAT Namespace was not
cleared by the agent.

This patch addresses the issue.

Change-Id: I55a16bcc0020087aa1abe76f5bc85cd64ccdaecd
Closes-Bug: #1796491
(cherry picked from commit cd0cc47a6ab0f7968a8c24e9d477909c45e4ae87)

commit_message:
Improve cinder::nova support for auth_type password

Add ability to configure the [nova] settings required when the auth_type
is password. This allows cinder to access the nova API as a privileged
user.

Change-Id: Ia357ea41f8472d47e266d853f120a14b767e880d
(cherry picked from commit 05d6b0851fea9da6e057cef295b39a77d1b6cca3)

Shouldn't use puppet 4 when running tests manually
while testing. This is last cycle we will support
puppet 4.

Change-Id: I6edb56a1fc85559e1f96cb93781e52e4e99ff889

commit_message:
Default PUPPET_MAJ_VERSION to 5

Shouldn't use puppet 4 when running tests manually
while testing. This is last cycle we will support
puppet 4.

Change-Id: I6edb56a1fc85559e1f96cb93781e52e4e99ff889

commit_message:
Update port pool with non-default values

Change the test to work with the namespaces, so it can run
non sequentually
Update port pool on newly created namespace with non-default values
Create new pods in that namespace
Check that port pool is working as before
Perform connectivity test between pods

Depends-On: Ic0dac5075418ec71e3beca48fdd811c5df1ff467
Change-Id: I13cca6f77c66e88788365cc7bf94ddcfa787c167

subject: Certificate changes should restart services
messages: [{'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-11-15 12:33:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2018-11-16 00:47:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-11-18 01:26:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-15 12:33:15.000000000', 'message': 'Certificate changes should restart services

Certificate changes or path changes in octavia::certificate
should notify the octavia::service::begin anchor so that services
are refreshed otherwise for example octavia-worker will not use a
new certificate.

Change-Id: Ie03cfedccc6a675976688a944b1ee91a0a9f55f1
(cherry picked from commit ab310a65e359a569672fbb60bab5d1403714a303)
'}]
commit_message:
Certificate changes should restart services

Certificate changes or path changes in octavia::certificate
should notify the octavia::service::begin anchor so that services
are refreshed otherwise for example octavia-worker will not use a
new certificate.

Change-Id: Ie03cfedccc6a675976688a944b1ee91a0a9f55f1
(cherry picked from commit ab310a65e359a569672fbb60bab5d1403714a303)

commit_message:
Add framework for octavia-status upgrade check

This commit adds the functionality of octavia-status CLI for performing
upgrade checks as part of the Stein cycle upgrade-checkers goal.
It only includes a sample check which must be replaced by real checks in
future.

Change-Id: I8b6d134b0bf5b5c82a19177fed6145ef8aaf7507
Story: 2003657
Task: 26146

commit_message:
Remove legacy-opensuse-423 nodeset

We no longer have any jobs using this nodeset, lets remove it.

Change-Id: Ie60cac31981777cb6f9a311dc5094e98252ceb1c
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/591525
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/591783
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/591788
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/591797
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/592462
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Improve logs when hard linking images fails

When hard linking images fail in ironic the logs doesn't have
enough related path information to resolve the underlying cause
of the exception.

Change-Id: I3331c4eca2deb9383f448f1efa93cbef53019f9c
Story: #2004303
Task: #27863

subject: Mock configuration load in unit tests
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-14 16:02:40.000000000', 'message': 'Mock configuration load in unit tests

Previously if you had an undercloud.conf in your home directory, the
tests would load it and use values from it as the defaults for the tests
if they were not overridden in the tests. This could lead to incorrect
failures. This change mocks the config loading out from the install and
upgrade actions for the undercloud to prevent this loading.

Change-Id: I57a12f0151bc65f26a7e880b0f1f367a7711ead9
Closes-Bug: #1803387
'}]
commit_message:
Mock configuration load in unit tests

Previously if you had an undercloud.conf in your home directory, the
tests would load it and use values from it as the defaults for the tests
if they were not overridden in the tests. This could lead to incorrect
failures. This change mocks the config loading out from the install and
upgrade actions for the undercloud to prevent this loading.

Change-Id: I57a12f0151bc65f26a7e880b0f1f367a7711ead9
Closes-Bug: #1803387

commit_message:
use payloads for SEGMENT BEFORE_DELETE callbacks

This patch switches over to the payload style of callbacks for SEGMENT
BEFORE_DELETE events. It does so by using the publish callback function
with DBEventPayload payloads. Corresponding listener callbacks are
updated where necessary.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: I64031129ad458d4468a316a9385288ced091d333

[{'created': '2018-11-08 11:20:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fix connection between 2 dvr routers

In case when 2 dvr routers are connected to each other with
tenant network, those routers needs to be always deployed
on same compute nodes.
So this patch changes dvr routers scheduler that it will create
dvr router on each host on which there are vms or other dvr routers
connected to same subnets.

Co-Authored-By: Swaminathan Vasudevan <SVasudevan@suse.com>

Closes-Bug: #1786272

commit_message:
Fix connection between 2 dvr routers

In case when 2 dvr routers are connected to each other with
tenant network, those routers needs to be always deployed
on same compute nodes.
So this patch changes dvr routers scheduler that it will create
dvr router on each host on which there are vms or other dvr routers
connected to same subnets.

Co-Authored-By: Swaminathan Vasudevan <SVasudevan@suse.com>

Closes-Bug: #1786272

Conflicts:
    neutron/agent/l3/agent.py
    neutron/db/l3_dvr_db.py
    neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_agent.py

Change-Id: I579c2522f8aed2b4388afacba34d9ffdc26708e3
(cherry picked from commit 5018d702415a6f056ff54d95447c5031e7e7d9b9)
(cherry picked from commit b127433f38d69fee48f89e9fc6b4a14dba8e9352)

commit_message:
[CI] Switch Xenial tempest jobs to Bionic Beaver

This change specifically ignores the grenade
job (manila-grenade), which is pending conversion
to zuulv3 because we need a way to set the default
python3 interpreter when running on Bionic Beaver.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/605291/
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/605242/
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/605810/
Change-Id: Ic49d4ac5ac36dd3b3d909941434b2d2f104a10b9

commit_message:
check the key id if in the model_obj

we should check the key id if in the model_obj

when release some network resources.

Signed-off-by: song baisen <songbaisen@szzt.com.cn>

Change-Id: Id30311516c240aae8938779938c51622202e3544
Co-Authored-By: tangzhuo <ztang@hnu.edu.cn>, zhiyuan_cai <luckyvega.g@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Ensure chrony is restarted

If chrony is already running, we need to make sure that we restart it if
necessary before waiting for the time syncs.

Change-Id: Ic3c7917a4edff46a77d48c07cd77a936f8e63a58
Related-Bug: #1802538

commit_message:
Allow the container backend to be configurable

We added a container backend in puppet-pacemaker via
Ia4a7b58d14d80e85d51e98acec1aad2ba90b69de. Let's now
let tripleo override it when needed.

Tested this via some hiera keys overrides and it works correctly.

Change-Id: I610923327462b901840131316a4984c8fe98faaa

commit_message:
Don't resolve Heat stack output when unnecessary

Retrieving the overcloud stack with its outputs is expensive for Heat,
let's skip it where we can.

Change-Id: Ifacdff939f7a8dedbcf2685595ebeb9340af092a
(cherry picked from commit e3bcc2440a72f6c3dc71e6a989cf7284cd3d611f)

So it looks like the change that broke this is https://review.openstack.org/#/c/613554/ which was also cherry-picked to stable/rocky so this is probably required there as well?  For that reason it would be good to file a bug and add the reference in the commit message since we will want one for that.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2018-11-07 16:19:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/616211/1 : FAILURE in 1h 51m 15s'}, {'account_id': 27215, 'date': '2018-11-08 01:50:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 27215, 'date': '2018-11-08 01:52:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

 > required there as well?  For that reason it would be good to file a
 > bug and add the reference in the commit message since we will want
 > one for that.

thank you for review. add it!'}, {'account_id': 27215, 'date': '2018-11-08 03:58:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27215, 'date': '2018-11-08 06:07:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2018-11-16 04:24:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Thanks for submitting the patch here, but I have some question about this change and bug:
Why fix a UT does not belong to neutron?
Why not directly mock the function you mentioned in the log in the tricircle? Can you figure out why tricircle does not have that `subnets` table? If subnets table is not required, you can mock the get_objects there.'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2018-11-16 12:47:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

The tricircle fix is proposed here
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/616104/
This can abandon now.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-11-16 14:22:28.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

as per LIU's comment, it looks that we don't need this change in neutron anymore. If it's not true, feel free to reopen this."}, {'account_id': 27215, 'date': '2018-11-17 02:47:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> The tricircle fix is proposed here
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/616104/

Sounds reasonable! Thank you!'}]

commit_message:
fix the tricircle unit test error

tricircle need pass the context for get_subnet.such as

  @patch.object(context, 'get_context_from_neutron_context')
    def test_subnet_clean(self, mock_context):
        self._basic_pod_route_setup()

        fake_plugin = FakePlugin()
        q_ctx = FakeNeutronContext()
        t_ctx = context.get_db_context()

if use the admin context will result in errors.see below:

http://logs.openstack.org/04/616104/1/check/openstack-tox-py27/83a5f70/testr_results.html.gz

Closes-bug:https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1802209

Change-Id: Ifd7f21521c728ead82c9f72f40530123e70c2ced

commit_message:
Delete zombie amphorae when detected

Zombie amphorae will be deleted by the system to lighten the load on
operators if the amphora record is still in the database.

Story: 2003912
Task: 26800

Change-Id: If133a3d36a9381bcca9f7d00f5c1531885907940
(cherry picked from commit df17903ab8cc8edc8da440dea6583ad1c56ffdbe)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-16 18:10:01.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the version discovery document

In Queens the API version discovery document did not include the
"links" section. This is causing problems with newer versions of the
openstacksdk.
This patch addes the "links" section to the version discovery document.

Change-Id: Id791339a912a15aa6dded31ce22baedb253c78a0
Story: 2004368
Task: 27970
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the version discovery document

In Queens the API version discovery document did not include the
"links" section. This is causing problems with newer versions of the
openstacksdk.
This patch addes the "links" section to the version discovery document.

Change-Id: Id791339a912a15aa6dded31ce22baedb253c78a0
Story: 2004368
Task: 27970
